alert.note: Alert for Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 1:11PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tompkins County through 145 PM EDT... At 111 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Danby, or near Ithaca, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newfield, Danby, South Danby, Besemer, West Danby, Newfield Hamlet, Robert H. Treman State Park and South Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
